abstract.p: Correction of July 18 article on Skechers USA: company earned $8.5 million in 1999 third quarter; it did not report loss; article on picture caption also misspelled name of marketing executive

block.p: Because of an editing error, an article in Business Day yesterday about Skechers U.S.A., the shoe company, misstated its financial performance for the third quarter of 1999. The company had net income of $8.5 million, down $5 million from the quarter a year earlier. It did not report a loss.

The article and a picture caption also misspelled the surname of the chief executive of Element Holdings Inc., a marketing firm, who commented on the popularity of the company's shoes. He is Kevin Umeh, not Ume.

Because of an editing error, an article in Business Day yesterday about Skechers U.S.A., the shoe company, misstated its financial performance for the third quarter of 1999. The company had net income of $8.5 million, down $5 million from the quarter a year earlier. It did not report a loss.

The article and a picture caption also misspelled the surname of the chief executive of Element Holdings Inc., a marketing firm, who commented on the popularity of the company's shoes. He is Kevin Umeh, not Ume.
